instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keep losing <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi.<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no liquid. Would power up then shut down almost instantly.
Found that <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> was missing and <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> wasnt putting out voltage to FETs. I replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and all HS FETS. After this, computer booted into OS. Then I checked VCORE and found it was fluctuating between .75V and 1.1V. After this fans got high and computer shut down. Now back to square one, computer shuts down almost instantly. Fans spin no Vcore.

PPBUS and <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5</SIGNAL> are 12.56V.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_CPUIMVP_VCC</SIGNAL> - 5V

6 Ohms on <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL>

Thanks. Have a good one.

Update - 

Changed <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, FETS and surrounding components again. Booted again for about 6 minutes with CPUVCORE at .75V then powered off. PPBUS was shorted to ground on <TRANSISTOR>Q7530</TRANSISTOR>. Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7530</TRANSISTOR> PPBUS short is gone. Now its in a power loop with 1.1V on VCORE............  Now Dead CPU, I'm assuming?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keep losing <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I have had a few like this and they always were a headache. Need to replace all FETs <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7541</CHIP>. Still you can expect issues as I have not had much success with this.
